metaData.descriptionCS: The child is read a sequence of numbers and letters and recalls the numbers in ascending order and the letters in alphabetical order.

questions.title: Qualifying Item: Counting
questions.correctInstructionsHTML:
Correct response:

[Correctly counts to at least 3]: Administer Alphabet.

questions.title: Qualifying Item: Alphabet
questions.correctInstructionsHTML:
Correct response:

[Correctly recites alphabet through the letter C]: Proceed to the Sample Item.

trials.correctInstructionsHTML:
Correct response:

Proceed to Trial 2 and introduce by saying,

Let’s try another one. B – 3.
trials.incorrectInstructionsHTML:
Incorrect response:

Say, That’s not quite right. I said A – 2. You should say 2 – A. The number goes first, then the letter. Let’s try again. A – 2.

Proceed to Trial 2 and introduce by saying,

Let’s try another one. B – 3.
trials.title: Sample Item Trial 1

trials.incorrectInstructionsHTML:
Incorrect response:

Say, That’s not quite right. I said B – 3. You should say 3 – B. The number goes first, then the letter. Let's try again. B – 3.
trials.title: Sample Item Trial 2

consecutiveZerosDiscontinueRule.description: This subtest discontinues after score of 0 on either qualifying item or scores of 0 on all 3 trials of an item.
